intro: Pithecellobium oligandrum, commonly known as the small-flowered pisonia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Pithecellobium oligandrum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
